definition: at once/right away/only/just (emphasis)/as early as/already/as soon as/then/in that case/as many as/even if/to approach/to move towards/to undertake/to engage in/to suffer/subjected to/to accomplish/to take advantage of/to go with (of foods)/with regard to/concerning

sentences.english: In Beijing, most branches serve four sittings in one day.
sentences.chinese: 在北京，很多分店一天有四個就餐時間段。

sentences.english: Eating utensils and food trays are cleaned at the hygiene station with premoistened towelettes.
sentences.chinese: 就餐器具和食物盤在衛生站用預先弄溼的小毛巾清理。

sentences.english: Two people are at a French château.
sentences.chinese: 這兩位路人在一座法國古堡中就餐。

sentences.english: Dining room is at ordinary times family dines jointly or the life space of repast of fete relatives and friends.
sentences.chinese: 餐室是平時家人共同進餐或宴請親友就餐的生活空間。

sentences.english: Very very slow small cherry dining.
sentences.chinese: 小櫻桃就餐十分十分慢。

sentences.english: Eating out costs a fortune, eating at home usually saves money.
sentences.chinese: 外出就餐費用很高，而在家裏喫，通常節省金錢。

sentences.english: Also, most restaurant¬s use the hated melamine chopsticks for dine-in.
sentences.chinese: 同時，大部分餐館使用含有三聚氰胺的筷子就餐。

sentences.english: At mealtimes, Japanese and mainland Chinese are seated in separate dining areas.
sentences.chinese: 在就餐時間，日本人和中國大陸人坐在不同的地方。

sentences.english: This in itself can bring you a more enjoyable dining experience.
sentences.chinese: 這本身就可以給您帶來更加愉快的就餐體驗。

sentences.english: London was singled as being particularly over-priced when it came to dining out.
sentences.chinese: 倫敦還被選爲超昂貴的外出就餐地。

sentences.english: But they still enjoy a nice dinner out.
sentences.chinese: 但他們仍然喜歡出外就餐。

sentences.english: In China, a traditional big square table usually dines eight persons.
sentences.chinese: 八仙桌通常可容八人就餐。

sentences.english: First of all, I rent a suit, and then I work hard at perfecting my eating manners.
sentences.chinese: 首先，我租了一套西服，然後惡補了一下就餐禮儀。

sentences.english: Meals are only provided with voucher payment.
sentences.chinese: 憑用餐代金券在太陽村食堂就餐。

sentences.english: Asking if a diner is ready to order.
sentences.chinese: 詢問就餐者是否準備點菜了。

definition: (at a restaurant) to order a meal/(of a waiter) to take an order
to have a meal/to eat/to make a living
separate meals/to eat individual meals (rather than taking one's food from plates served to everyone at the table)
communal meal/formal dinner of club or group
